intro: Androcymbium albanense subsp. clanwilliamense, commonly known as the Clanwilliam bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered flowers that attract pollinators. This subspecies is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its beauty.
